title: How to Find a Lost Nintendo Switch: Complete Guide

steps.title: Grab a spare pair of Joy-Cons that are connected to the Switch.
steps.content: Grab a spare pair of Joy-Cons that are connected to the Switch. This method only works if you have a second pair of Joy-Cons synced with the lost Nintendo Switch. This method will also only work if the Switch is turned on or in sleep mode.

steps.title: Press the Home button on the Joy-Con.
steps.content: Press the Home button on the Joy-Con. If the Switch is nearby, this will cause it to wake up out of sleep mode.

steps.title: Press the L and R buttons on the Joy-Cons.
steps.content: Press the L and R buttons on the Joy-Cons. Watch to see if the Joy-Cons connect. If they do, continue to the next step. If not, repeat steps 2 and 3 until the Joy-Cons connect.

steps.title: Press and hold the Home button for a few seconds.
steps.content: Press and hold the Home button for a few seconds. This will open the quick menu on your Switch.

steps.title: Move the left joystick down three times.
steps.content: Move the left joystick down three times. This will move the cursor to the volume settings in the quick menu.

steps.title: Push the joystick left and right.
steps.content: Push the joystick left and right. This will increase and decrease the volume on the Switch, which will cause it to make a noise. This noise will help you locate your Switch. [1] X Research source Note: The noise that your Switch makes when adjusting the volume is pretty faint. You'll need to listen closely to hear the sound, and you may not hear it if your Switch is buried under some blankets or stuck between the couch cushions.

steps.title: Try to remember the last place you used your Switch.
steps.content: Try to remember the last place you used your Switch. If you're sure your Switch is lost in the house but you're not able to locate it with your Joy-Cons, try to retrace your steps. Check any places that you're sure you used your Switch (such as the living room or your bedroom). If anyone else in your home uses your Switch, check with them to see if they know where the device is or if they used it last. If you use your Switch in the car, check your vehicle or your purse/backpack for the device.

steps.title: Call local law enforcement to report a stolen or missing Switch.
steps.content: Call local law enforcement to report a stolen or missing Switch. If you think your Switch has been stolen or you've misplaced it in a public place, contact local police to file a report . You will need the Switch's serial number and a description of the device. You may also be asked for proof of ownership, which Nintendo is not able to provide. [2] X Research source
